## 📚 Featured Datasets — Where Stories Begin

Each of these datasets offers more than numbers—they’re story engines. Click to expand.

<!-- nycflights13 -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>✈️ <strong>nycflights13</strong> — Delays, Weather, and the Rhythm of Motion</summary>

**What it is:** All flights departing NYC in 2013, linked to weather, airlines, and airports.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Rich joins (flights ⇄ weather ⇄ carriers) + time series + networks.\
**Story sparks:** Morning fog as nationwide dominoes; how buffer time beats chronic delay; the “geography of luck” in departure times.

</details>

<!-- gapminder -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🌍 <strong>gapminder</strong> — Development in Motion</summary>

**What it is:** Country-level health, wealth, and population over time.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Long horizons + comparable units = clean cross-country narratives.\
**Story sparks:** Convergence vs. divergence; health gains without wealth; “late bloomers” that flip the script.

</details>

<!-- Lahman -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>⚾ <strong>Lahman Baseball Database</strong> — The Game as a Mirror of Culture</summary>

**What it is:** Player/team stats from the 19th century to now.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Deep history, rule changes, moneyball eras—quant + culture.\
**Story sparks:** Expansion, integration, and the long-ball epochs; globalization in surnames and birthplaces.

</details>

<!-- NOAA -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🌦️ <strong>NOAA Daily Weather</strong> — Memory of the Sky</summary>

**What it is:** Decades of daily observations for thousands of stations (GHCN).\
**Why it’s worthy:** Local variability meets climate trends; perfect for “weather memory” ideas.\
**Story sparks:** How yesterday biases today (humans & grids); asymmetries in extremes.

</details>

<!-- TfL -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🚇 <strong>Transport for London (TfL)</strong> — Motion of a Metropolis</summary>

**What it is:** Open ridership, delays, closures, and more from London Underground.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Network effects + peak waves = emergent patterns.\
**Story sparks:** Fragility maps; how small failures ripple; the true “rush” in rush hour.

</details>

<!-- UCI Online Retail -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🛍️ <strong>UCI Online Retail</strong> — Human Behavior in Transactions</summary>

**What it is:** Line-item invoices for a UK e-commerce retailer (2010–2011).\
**Why it’s worthy:** Basket analysis, seasonality, long-tail dynamics.\
**Story sparks:** Product co-occurrence graphs; rare combos that drive profit; return behavior arcs.

</details>

<!-- FRED -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>💰 <strong>FRED Economic Data</strong> — The Pulse of Economies</summary>

**What it is:** US/international macro time series (inflation, jobs, rates).\
**Why it’s worthy:** High-frequency, consequential, and composable.\
**Story sparks:** Recession “fingerprints”; sectoral divergence; policy shock timelines.

</details>

<!-- NASA MODIS -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🛰️ <strong>NASA MODIS / Earth Observatory</strong> — A Planet in Pixels</summary>

**What it is:** Satellite observations (vegetation, fires, aerosols, ice).\
**Why it’s worthy:** Visual storytelling + measurable change.\
**Story sparks:** Greening/ browning cycles; fire seasons as migrating fronts; glacier retreat as lived time.

</details>

<!-- Steam -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🕹️ <strong>Steam Games</strong> — Collective Taste in the Wild</summary>

**What it is:** Game metadata, reviews, tags, and (often) playtime stats.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Social proof, hype cycles, networked preference landscapes.\
**Story sparks:** Genre constellations; the life cycle of hits; price elasticity vs. review sentiment.

</details>

<!-- Global Urban Footprint -->

<details class="dataset">

<summary>🌆 <strong>Global Urban Footprint</strong> — Cities from Space</summary>

**What it is:** High-resolution, satellite-derived urban extent worldwide.\
**Why it’s worthy:** Comparable geometry of cities across cultures and terrains.\
**Story sparks:** Edge growth vs. infill; coastal constraints; night-lights vs. census discrepancies.

</details>
